Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to prove that the shoppers in the video were fleeing from police during the COVID-19 lockdown.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the shoppers in the video were fleeing from police during the COVID-19 lockdown without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The video footage has been previously circulated online in reports about a police raid on a brothel in Karachi in 2015, suggesting an alternative explanation for the events shown in the video.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video was not filmed on Tariq Road in Karachi, as claimed, but in Khadda Market, as confirmed by local police and verified through Google Maps.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the situation by presenting it as shoppers fleeing from police during the COVID-19 lockdown, while the actual context of the video is different.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any aspect of the situation.
